    • Method Detail

      • forward

        public abstract Matrix forward(Matrix Y_hat,
                               Matrix Y_gt)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        An abstract method to calculate the error between predictions inside Y_hat and the ground truth Y_gt. This method should always produce a singleton Matrix (i.e. a Matrix with dims (1,1))
        Parameters:
        Y_hat - the predictions. Should have dims (N, k) where N is the number of examples, and k is the dim of each example
        Y_gt - the ground truth. Should have dims (N, k) where N is the number of examples, and k is the dim of each example
        Returns:
        the singleton Matrix contining the error
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if Y_hat and Y_gt don't have the same dimensionality

      • backwards

        public abstract Matrix backwards(Matrix Y_hat,
                                 Matrix Y_gt)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        An abstract method to calculate the derivative of the errow with respect to the predictions Y_hat. The dimensionality of the output should always have the same dimentionality as Y_hat
        Parameters:
        Y_hat - the predictions. Should have dims (N, k) where N is the number of examples, and k is the dim of each example
        Y_gt - the ground truth. Should have dims (N, k) where N is the number of examples, and k is the dim of each example
        Returns:
        the derivative of the error with respect to Y_hat
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if Y_hat and Y_gt don't have the same dimensionality
